text: Is there any possibility to add blog-compability with the new custom module after created (choosing only page when creating it)?
<@U7W3LPNUT> I couldnt figure out where, I had to copy the code and rebuild the modules in a new custom module

<@U25C65C3S> Yeah, same here. Very irritating when you've already put them into multiple page templates and then realise you need to rebuild it to work in the blog as well... You should at least get the option when cloning the module so you don't have to create each field once more in the new module, but that isn't the case here either :thumbsdown:
Ping <@U22PNRAJD>  :smile:
I agree <@U22PNRAJD> :point_up:
lol

Hello, I need help First, 
I have a problem to create a perfect responsive website with HubSpot COS, is there any way to include bootstrap files to my website cos or how can I improve my design to be compatible with any browser and different screens.
Second, I need to add on the blog image Hover zoom in and shadow  as the custom design attached in this mail.

Third , how I can activate post filter tag after click on it to filter the blogs while the page is refreshed as I click on it ? Can I use the page url how can I do it as a developer ?, I attached the design below .

Here is my custom design attached in this mail and here is the live link I wanna improve it like the design <https://blog.solna.io/>

Thanks in Advance
<@U831KMEMS> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U831KMEMS/F8DFW3M6D/blog-1__1_.png|Blog-1.png>

<@U831KMEMS> HubSpot has the grid from bootstrap 2, you can add the functionality from newer versions of bootstrap in, in a hybrid fashion to allow for the design builder, or just roll your own coded template instead, but you will need to make sure you're properly handling each HS component.

most of your questions are  html javascript and CSS related and not really HubSpot related. 

I would highly encourage you to check out <http://css-tricks.com|css-tricks.com> which has great articles explaining how to achieve different looks with html css and javascript.

Beyond that I think you'd get a lot of value out of <https://www.codecademy.com/>

based on what you said, I would focus on the css and jQuery tracks, maybe vanilla javascript as well(there's always the debate of which is better to learn first, I think jQuery will atleast get you up and going faster on your project, but down the road I highly recommend learning javascript as well, jQuery alone will only get you so far)

Wondering if anyone has had any success moving the 'submit' button on the form builder, inline with the rest of the fields. 

This is what I am trying to achieve – after some CSS tweaks I am close, but the subscribe/submit button still wants to sit below.
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
<@U795QFHDE> <https://www.square2marketing.com/blog>
if you want to check out the css on there
It is a pain.
Thanks – I'll take a look. Sounds like there is no simple work around.
how would you assign a contact with a unique ID in HubSpot
how would you check against the value to see if it is unique?
<@U795QFHDE> we did it here: <http://www.anahuacmayab.mx>
A file, which can't be shown because your team is past the free storage limit, was commented on.
You can hash their email, or IP into an MD5 or mabey a salt of multiple items like time.
The leave a local storage on their machine.
when they submit a form attach that salted identifier to their contact record that way it always is tied to their email address.
<@U795QFHDE> I did it here in a subscribe form. it will work the same tho. I used flex box and a big sledge hammer. <https://www.fpainc.com/blog#hs_cos_wrapper_module_1510346313424360>
